page.title: 13Housing in Swanley
page.content: The town of Swanley is quite new. Nearly all of the 6,915 households occupy houses,bungalows,flats or Maisonettes which were built in the 20th centuary.The station-master's house,built in 1862,is the oldest building in the town.Some of the houses ,built on either side of the High street in about 1900,are still without proper bathrooms. Apart from the two housing estates at Hart-Dyke road and Lullingstone Avenue, which were built in the 1920's by Dartford rural council.No new roads were built in Swanley untill after the war.A small number of houses built by local builders in the 1930's are to be found on the two main roads,London to Dover,Dartford-Sevenoaks.
